text: Also, 'Fun-Time Organic Barn Juice' is priceless.

name: skiddyfisk
text: What is a cedarn finial?

name: sstralka
text: A finial is a type of architectural ornament, and "cedarn" indicates it's made of cedar. What this has to do with high cholesterol is not yet clear to me.

name: arbys
text: Curse and drat!

name: neonfreon
text: it means he is alive, he is a man, and he eats like a man.

name: ttagxamm
text: Right, he means to say, "Of course my cholesterol is high, I'm not a block of wood."

name: soticoto
text:
Your kitty icon fills me with glee.
I am completely ignoring the fact that you are just rehashing previous analysis of the comment in favour of chubbying your post for the paranoid gray cat alone.

name: tekende
text: It was pretty amusing until the cat looked right into the camera. Then it was terrifying.

name: aelindil
text:
When You look into the Cat,
the Cat looks into You.

name: coldfrog
text: Unfortunately, the epilogue to the novel has the main beau realizing that he can no longer love a woman who has inferior knowledge of pitons, and abandons her memory for a local chess pro with an amputated leg.  The body is never recovered.

name: straw
text: But in the sequel we learn that his bittersweet romance with the chess pro is in fact his long-lost love after she lost her leg, regained her hearing, lost her memory and had to have facial reconstructive surgery after the fall!  But can she ever love him again?

name: soticoto
text:
Little is said, but once her dark secret is revealed, the alarmed protagonist attempts to escape. With the help of her athletic brother, the ever more bitter heroine catches her once lover and has him locked in the basement. His next sight of her is a silohuette in the light of the doorway at the top of the stairs, crutch in one hand and whip in the other.
With the relationship having taken a sinister turn, we can only wonder... where will it go from here?

name: jlynes
text: This sounds like a job for Dr. Manflesh!

name: soticoto
text:
TO THE FLESHMOBILE!

*Fap fap fap*

name: nigelchaos
text: Which, ironically enough... looks just like a Nintendo.

name: wae
text: definitely gonna make room for the double-armed yawn in my morning routine

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: Me too! Followed closely by the double-handed scrotum scratch. Finest way to start the day.

name: soticoto
text:
One hand from the front, one from behind.
Nowhere for the morning itch to escape to.

name: radishes
text: Yeah did anybody else stretch their arms ahead of them while reading that?

name: johnnylandmine
text: Yes.

name: sstralka
text: For what it's worth, a search for the exact phrase "cedarn finial" on Google yields no hits. Take off the quotation marks, and the first result you get is this .

name: zoom
text: 'the fuck?

name: straw
text: It is a word poem as well as a glaring example of why word poems are terrible. (Presumably we're supposed to be delighted by the inclusion of select architectural terms such as "finial" in relation to "groin pain.")

name: drskradley
text:
First sentence: "Areally bestiary took occur kilns technics noun [url]mesothelioma attorney[url=http://www.rpwb.com/mesothelioma/] yea stipend invent excite frazzle groin pain."

Last sentence: "Shaver square cocoons amigo round manchet hurry outcast product bed younkers mentally exorable gayness when tomtits sodomite."

Wow.

name: alphagator
text:
That is no word poem, my friend.

Fully 90% of the time you see a link with with the term mesothelioma, it's SEO spam with an advertisement on it.

The random obscure words on there are for when people use bizarre terms like you've used and they're the only hit.

That's because, for quite some time, 'mesothelioma' fetched the highest per-click reward on Adsense.

THE MORE YOU KNOW

name: straw
text:
See, I'm a graduate of a writing program and I was thinking that that was a fine example of a word poem, based off of what I've seen. ANd by fine example, as I said above, a fine example of how much word poems blow.

Seriously, I've been to readings where people read word poems that resemble those pages, except much longer. I wish I were joking.

name: invidious
text: Joyce's "Ulysses"?

name: clovis
text: You fail at being an literary jerk. You meant Finnegans Wake.

name: sstralka
text: Interesting.  I considered various possibilities for what the fuck this might be (coded message to terrorist cell; avant-garde literature [cf. the word poem hypothesis]; ravings of a madman) but SEO spam was not one of them.  I'm glad I didn't buy anything from the bastards.

name: dejavroom
text: Pish-posh!

name: daily
text: I've had breakfast disappointment before, but never on that level.  Cornelius is one resilient old bear.  I might have just topped myself.

name: coolbreeze3
text: A comment left by coolbreeze3 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by zumicroom, Moolah, odei, DigDugz, joebot, nilehus, DickLaurent)

name: coolbreeze3
text: oh man, I totally screwed that one up. LAME'd

name: spinynorman
text:
Whenever I hear Cornelius talk in my head, he sounds either like Stephen Fry or Alec Guinness as George Smiley from Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy.

Maybe the latter. Short, fat, big, thick glasses, almost entirely unaware that the world has been modernized, and fond of books no one's heard about.

name: ricnine
text: Funny you think of Stephen Fry, because my "inner Cornelius voice" is Hugh Laurie.

name: skiddyfisk
text: Mine is Helmut Bakaitis .

name: jackparsons
text: Woohoo! The Doctor in "Jasper Morello"!

name: soticoto
text:
Loyd Grossman.

Here are just two of the various reasons why:

#1. Toff American. Super-rare by my rating. Americans just aren't supposed to have that old-fashioned upper class feel to them. There certainly wasn't any suggestion as far as I'm aware that Cornelius was from anywhere else though, and he sure is retroposh.

#2. Pasta. Remember the Badass games? Loyd Grossman claims to have invented at least two types of pasta. For that matter the underlying food theme is present with both of 'em.

Totally logical conclusion, if you ask me.

name: euphemisms
text: mine is david attenborough

name: stuart
text: Hmm!

name: radishes
text: Cornelius is the smart face of Fry with the tongue of Laurie.

name: mrclarinet
text: Mine is whichever generic plummy old English guy is being ruthlessly marketed to milk the dollars out of fat Anglophilic secretaries from Ohio who "just love an English accent"

name: spinynorman
text:
Man, really? Laurie plays way more of a twit, usually... Fry's more like an aristocratic Oxford don. Like, my Hugh Laurie impression is just me sqauwking, "Oh, I say!" and then falling down a flight of stairs.

My House impression is just me with a cane. As you can tell I'm not very good at them.

Laurie needs to gets some role where his character's schtick is that he sits in a very comfortable chair and eats gourmet pudding. Now that would be an act.

name: aarongstock
text: I presume you perform your House impression after your Hugh Laurie impression.

name: spinynorman
text: I usually need to, I sacrifice the body for my art

name: stuart
text: Chubby for conjuring up the very mental image of Hugh Laurie

name: i_love_kate
text: Chubby for casting Laurie as L.

name: sstralka
text: John Houseman!

name: lolsworth
text: Sydney Greenstreet.

name: jackparsons
text: John Hodgman. No question.

text: I don't think there is.  There's one for Vlad and Lie Bot was in it, but I don't recall one for Lie Bot.

name: ttagxamm
text: C'mon, don't lame this guy. If there was a Lie Bot flow chart, why would he tell the truth about it?

name: dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately
text: A comment left by dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by foolio, bearealcoolhand, Wolfslice)

name: paperboy_2000
text:
Absolutely agree. Chris is a terrific writer and clearly loves the English language, so he'll certainly understand when I say, "IT BURNS! IT BURNS MY EYES!"

Padres pitcher Chris Young was quoted in the paper today, complimenting another pitcher by saying, "His arm was literally electric." I know there's a lot of emphasis being placed on steroids, but I think bionic limbs should also be illegal. Yeah, he's a baseball player but he also went to Princeton, so he should be setting good grammatical examples for all the kids out there.

name: aarongstock
text: Well, to be fair, unless you're dead, your arm is electric[al]. It's just a tautology in this case.

name: locuscosecant
text: Nothing ungrammatical there, he's just using the term "literally" figuratively.

name: mattylite
text:
I proscribe all this prescriptive linguistics. Ain't how language works.

Also, what would proscriptive linguistics be, if it were a thing?

Also, I do think it is hilarious that "literally" has developed a usage in which it means the exact opposite of what it usually does. That's a rare honor for a word. Like "bad" or "sick" or stuff like that.

Also, shit, why am I talking to people from 11 months ago like it is the present?

name: zefiel
text: Dude that was a Grand Time indeed.

name: straw
text: Manflesh delivers the perspective.

name: atrusrand
text: No, Cornelius. There are others who also posess the appreciation of the double-armed yawn. I among them. Cheer up, old chap.

name: afkpuz
text:
I, too, sport the double-armed yawn.

Men ask me if I am doing such an activity for the theatrics, and I respond, "nay sir."

name: tekende
text: And they say "Okay but that response right there, that was totally for the theatrics, I don't care what you say."

name: steerpike66
text:
AW! Life is hard for the bon viveur widow on a shoe-string harassed by an officious medic! I loved bacon photocopied onto bleached chamois.

And more people should say PSHAW! Also BLACKGUARD!

name: steerpike66
text: And I did mean widower. Really.

name: zoom
text:
Mr. Bear has long been my favorite character. This insight into his psyche delights me to no end.

The picture of him glaring dissapprovingly at Phillippe gave me giggles.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: The otter is deciding which parts of his body will NOT end up in a dogfood can.

name: cailetshadow
text:
Cautiously, with careful precision, he decides that he can keep his eyes and the 7 square inches of flesh that surround them.

This is a Bad Decision.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text:
Once the otter realises this, he will make the call to his Mom. He will admit his failing.

His Mom will feel disappointment.

name: straw
text: This totally goes against what he told Beef he usually eats in his interview. Perhaps he was just saying that because, while that's all there is available to eat, that is never what he wants to eat and just made a big show of it to keep up appearances.

name: biff
text: Damn those faulty pitons!

name: paperboy_2000
text: I love the "Make Sense of Yesterday" box.  Waking up in that house, Cornelius must feel like a forensic scientist trying to figure out who set off the shenanigans bomb the night before.

name: jlynes
text:
Not hailing from the San Francisco area, I was curious as to the components of the "Hangtown Fry" .

Honestly, how could Cornelius NOT have that for breakfast?

name: rogergs
text: It is a sad memento of the passage of time that the California State Legislature would today rather volunteer en masse for reverse liposuction than select the worthy Fry as the state dish.

name: jlynes
text:
While there are a great many things that embarrass me about my home state (the governor, the legislature, the glorification of stupidity), the unofficial state dish is not one of them. Only here in Texas will you find the true expression of the sublime chicken fried steak. There's something about beef that's been battered, fried, and covered in white gravy that brings a tear to my eye.

The official state dish is chili, but everybody knows who the REAL king is.

name: wae
text: I didn't know what it was until this strip, and shed a tear of happiness when I read the recipe.

name: tellumo
text: It kinda puts me in mind of the Skip's Scramble from Arrested Development .

name: ravindra108
text: I love the fact that his steaks (plural) are smothered in veal. If you're going for it, go for it !

name: augeno13
text: 5'd for the look Mr. Bear gives Philipe

name: overmedicated
text: I'm not sure why the slightly bigger EARLY in the last box cracks me up, it just does. I think of him talking like Stephen Fry. Maybe I'm just cliched.

name: daily
text: I don't think EARLY is any bigger, it's just that each word GO...TO...WORK...EARLY is a little lower than the one before it.  Even typing those words is making me feel low, I'll tell you that.  Great, and quite subtle, use of graphic design.  What did C. Bear do with himself in the (not too distant) past before the D & C opened?

name: nighttoad
text: but i thought cornelius liked running the dude and catastrophe. my first thought when i saw the words "go to work early" written all askew was that he was a little tipsy from the bailey's he drank with his breakfast.

name: thommy_h
text: FUCKING GLORIOUS

name: henrythecad
text:
I know we don't post the alt text anymore, but this is too much.

''The tomato is poached very gently, so as not to create Excitement.''

name: killerlimpet
text: I miss the alt-text postings.

name: johnnylandmine
text: That's a silly thing to do. The alt text is now just as viewable in Assetbar as it is on the front page.

name: killerlimpet
text: I am aware of that. I rather enjoyed seeing the race to be first, the titterings about said race, the ritual, etc.

name: zefiel
text: You need more excitement in your life.

name: hollis
text: At least it's better than the "1st p0st lol butts" nonsense on Red vs. Blue.

name: killerlimpet
text: I am a math major.

name: songbirdspectre
text: dammit philippe. why would you do that?

name: justdan
text: Yeah Philippe why do you gotta do a thing?

name: shogun
text: Things like 'hangtown fry' being used to comedic effect is a fair bit of why I love this strip. See also: Kinky Abelour.  I mean...Hangtown Fry?? Vintage Cornelius, and he only just established it! THAT is bad-ass.

name: phy
text: That IS grand.

name: zefiel
text: No, Cornelius. You're not the only one getting some two-fisted yawning action upon waking, Ray does too. And i kinda like his style better.

name: hollis
text: His is a fully-articulated, bent-elbow multisyllabic yawn.  A true player's yawn.  But Cornelius' is the yawn of a gentleman.  Naturally.

name: afkpuz
text:
A gross of oysters?

That is so many oysters.

name: biff
text: Of course, tragically, the piton lady waited too long to release herself from her harness, and the piton fails anyway, and Derek falls to his death right beside her, where they lie, broken bodies mingled together, until the spring floods.

name: tekende
text: Ha!

name: ford
text:
For some reason i can only read that as a triumphant exclamation.

Ha! That'll teach you to have a beautiful relationship with a deaf rock climber!

name: mrclarinet
text: What the hell is Phillipe trying to draw on his face?

name: astro_zombie
text: I've now used this to plan out my day and I feel more badass already.

name: stuartc
text: As well as 'pshaw', I would like 'tish and fipsy' and 'flimshaw' to be added to the everyday canon...

name: persnicket
text: I put it to you that Cornelius says "Oh bother" just like Winnie the Pooh who is also a bear. There is a fun parallel to be drawn.

name: persnicket
text: Will you draw it?

name: budenhagen
text: I've always thought that Achewood has a parallel to the Hundred Acre Wood. Beef is Eeyore, totally. Ray would probably be Tigger, Philippe would be Piglet, I guess, and Pat would be Rabbit. I actually saw an episode with Rabbit in it not too long ago, and the only thing I could think is "Man, Rabbit is a DICK."

name: neonfreon
text:
WHO IS POOH

WHAT IS HAND

name: sstralka
text: Clearly Pooh would have to be whichever character you could write a book about called "The Tao of XXX." So far "The Tao of Ray" is the one that makes the most sense to me. Although it's admittedly not perfect, I can imagine a sentence along the lines of, "While Roast Beef frets, and Pat chastises, and Lyle pukes, Ray simply is .

name: astro_zombie
text:
And both the humans are called Christopher!

I can't not think of this now!

name: stormagnet
text: Oh, damn. To follow this to its natural conclusion, wouldn't that make Teodor Pooh? Like astro_zombie, I can't unthink this thought.

name: honesttom
text: Cornelius should totally replace Winnie the Pooh. Pooh has been going downhill ever since he started turning tricks for Disney. I heard that he's now virtually a shut-in, eating up to forty jars of honey a day, has to be propped up by Piglet when he goes on stage, stands there sweating and swaying for about ten minutes before being booed off. Cornelius can beat that.

name: estutius
text: While they both probably say "Oh bother," Cornelius would say it because of a genuine annoyance. Winnie the Pooh says it because he is too simple-minded to comprehend what is going on.

name: stormagnet
text: But, Cornelius wouldn't be Pooh; he'd be Owl, right?

name: johnnylandmine
text: I like how this is not a "Decision-Making Flowchart," but rather a "Thought and Decision Minder."

name: stuntman
text: i feel like cornelieus every time i go to my fridge, trash

name: professoryes
text: Cornelius needs to try one of Pat's best-itutes.

name: honesttom
text: No he doesn't. Nobody does. Ever.

name: johnnylandmine
text:
Really. It's entirely possible to be a successful vegetarian without eating anything you need to go to the asshole store to buy. I know people who even manage it as vegans.

Though I guess if you're looking to get in on the "sanctimonious prick" level, then I guess it's pretty much a must.

name: professoryes
text: The Asshole Store. Tell me something like that exists, and they have horrendous vegan food to sell.

name: professoryes
text: In the interest of love, I will agree.

name: estutius
text: Steamed raisins? Wouldn't that just be warm grapes?

name: kledermans
text:
Kind of like warm reconstituted grapes.
Like grape zombies.

name: professoryes
text: And mull the days they didn't become wine.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: Someone wake up Chris! It's almost one!!

name: zefiel
text: I NEED MY FIX,  MAAAN! MY EFFING FIX!

name: mnrsiat
text: Hm, that breakfast is not actually proscribed, it is prescribed; the proscribed one is unfortunately Cornelius's preferred oysters and veal.  It's a one-letter difference, but Cornelius really ought to know which is which.

name: professoryes
text: The hidden nature of cholesterol.

name: lauralou
text:
I'm glad that someone else feels the same as me about veggie bacon, it is seriously WRONG!

If ever I feel a craving for (real) bacon, all I have to do is think about that stuff and I'm over it for months!

name: liquid_banjo
text: How do you juice a barn?

name: kleptonis
text: Everybody has their first Achewood strip. This one is mine, and I couldn't have picked a better one.

name: hrm
text: that is not a theme. :(

name: hrm
text: (I am referring to "THEME?" near the beginning.)

text: hit the nail on the head with the veggie bacon. the stuff appears to be naugahyde. tastes ok tho.

text: Cornelius has nought but contempt for his audience

text: Best description of fake. Bacon. Ever.

text: That's grand.
